name: 5-(2,4-dichlorobenzylidene)-2,2-dimethyl-1,3-dioxane-4,6-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1812
Reason: The compound has a dioxane ring, which has a melting point of 105 degrees Celsius. The 2,4-dichlorobenzene group contributes to the melting point due to increased molecular weight and electronegativity, estimated at +50 degrees Celsius. The methyl groups attached to the dioxane ring and the benzene group also contribute to the melting point due to increased molecular weight, estimated at +10 degrees Celsius each. The ester group (-COO-) can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius. Finally, the presence of a carbonyl group can increase the melting point due to increased polarity and resonance stability, estimated at +30 degrees Celsius.
